Class Menu

  • java.lang.Object
    • Menu

  • public class Menu
extends java.lang.Object
    This is an implementation of a Menu class which is used to display the conversion menu to user.
    Version:
    8/2/2019
    Author:
    Jonathan Kohler

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      java.io.PrintWriter pw

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Menu(java.io.PrintWriter pw, SuperOut so)
      This is the default constructor for Menu.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void display()
      This method displays the main menu that contains options for conversions.
      int getSelection()
      This method returns the selected menu option from inputCheck().
      void inputCheck()
      This method receives input from user and is validated using boolean and if statement.

      • Menu

        public Menu(java.io.PrintWriter pw,
            SuperOut so)
        This is the default constructor for Menu. PrintWriter object is passed through this method for file writing in Menu Class.

        so - superOut

    • Method Detail

      • display

        public void display()
        This method displays the main menu that contains options for conversions.

      • getSelection

        public int getSelection()
        This method returns the selected menu option from inputCheck().
        Returns:
        int selection

      • inputCheck

        public void inputCheck()
        This method receives input from user and is validated using boolean and if statement. Input is not valid when input is out of range.
